trans-unit.source: Provides methods to write to an [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] document or print queue.
XpsDocumentWriter has no constructor.

To create an XpsDocumentWriter, use the static <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument.CreateXpsDocumentWriter%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> class or use one of the static <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.CreateXpsDocumentWriter%2A> methods of the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> class.
The document or the queue that creates the XpsDocumentWriter becomes the target to which it writes.
Cancels the current <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WriteAsync*> operation.
No asynchronous write operation is in progress.
Returns a <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument"></xref> that can write <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> objects to a document or print queue.

The <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument> writes to the same target <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> or <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> as the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter> that creates the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument>.
The new <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument"></xref>.

Returns a <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument"></xref> that can write <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> objects with <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> settings to an XPS document or print queue.

The <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument> writes to the same target <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> or <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> as the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter> that creates the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument>.
This method does not validate or modify the specified `documentPrintTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.

If necessary, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is specific to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> and valid for a specified printer.
A <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> that specifies the default printing preferences for the document sequence.
A <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> that represents the default printing preferences for each document.

The new <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument"></xref> that writes <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> elements with <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> settings to the <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref>.

Writes synchronously a specified [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] document to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.

Although the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> class has a singular name, an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> can be one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of multiple documents.

This method adds the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> elements in the source to the set of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> elements in the target <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> or <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.

This Write method will reserialize the specified [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] document which will remove all content from the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package> that is not required to be preserved by the [XML Paper Specification](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=65761).

The reserialization will also remove all extensions from the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> markup, including any extended [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] content.
By design this Write method does not call the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WritingPrintTicketRequired> event.
The path of the source document.

Writes synchronously paginated content from a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator"></xref> to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.
An object that contains a pointer to unpaginated source material and also contains methods for paginating the material.

Writes synchronously a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument"></xref> to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.

Although the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> class has a singular name, an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> can be one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of multiple documents.
This method adds a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> to the set.
A document that is written to the <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref>.

Writes synchronously a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocumentSequence"></xref> to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.

Although the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> class has a singular name, an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> can be one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of multiple documents.
This method adds a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> elements to the existing set.
A set of documents that is written to the <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref>.

Writes synchronously a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.
A page that is written to the <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref>.

Writes synchronously a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.
To batch write a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Visual>, use <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> that is written.

Writes synchronously a specified [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] document to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.

When `notificationLevel` is disabled, the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter> copies the serialized[!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] document to the target <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> or <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> that created the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter>.

When `notificationLevel` is enabled, the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter> first deserializes the document, next reserializes it, and then writes it to the target with progress notifications as each page is output.

Although the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> class has a singular name, an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> can be one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of multiple documents.

This method adds the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> elements in the source to the sequence of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> elements in the target <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> or <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.
If `notificationLevel` is specified as <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentNotificationLevel>, notifications are produced only when the document is serialized, not printed.
To receive notifications the document must be reserialized.

When a document is reserialized all content from the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package> that is not required to be preserved by the [XML Paper Specification (XPS)](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=65761) is removed.

The reserialization will also remove all extensions from the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> markup, including any extended [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] content.
If `notificationLevel` is specified as <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentNotificationLevel> the document will not be reserialized and any extended content will be preserved, even when printed.
By design this Write method does not call the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WritingPrintTicketRequired> event.
The path of the source document.
An indication of whether notification is enabled.

Writes synchronously paginated content from a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator"></xref> together with a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.
This method does not validate or modify the specified `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.

If necessary, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is specific to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> and is valid for a specified printer.
An object that contains a pointer to unpaginated source material and also contains methods for paginating the material.
A <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> that represents the default printing preferences for material.

Writes synchronously a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument"></xref> together with a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.

Although the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> class has a singular name, an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> can be one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of multiple documents.
This method adds a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> to the set.
This method does not validate or modify the specified `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.

If necessary, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is specific to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> and is valid for a specified printer.
The document that is written.
A <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> that represents the default printing preferences for the document.

Writes synchronously a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocumentSequence"></xref> together with a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.

Although the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> class has a singular name, an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> can be one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of multiple documents.
This method adds a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> elements to the existing set.
This method does not validate or modify the specified `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.

If necessary, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is specific to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> and is valid for a specified printer.
The set of documents that are written.
A <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> that represents the default printing preferences for the set of documents.

Writes synchronously a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> together with a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.
This method does not validate or modify the specified `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.

If necessary, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is specific to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> and is valid for a specified printer.
The page that is written.
A <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> that represents the default printing preferences for the page.

Writes synchronously a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> together with a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.
To batch write a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Visual>, use <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument>.
This method does not validate or modify the specified `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.

If necessary, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is specific to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> and is valid for a specified printer.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> that is written.
A <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> that represents the default printing preferences for the document.

Writes asynchronously a specified [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] document to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.

Although the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> class has a singular name, an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> can be one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of multiple documents.

This method adds the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> elements in the source to the set of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> elements in the target <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> or <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.

This WriteAsync method will reserialize the specified [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] document which will remove all content from the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package> that is not required to be preserved by the [XML Paper Specification](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=65761).

The reserialization will also remove all extensions from the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> markup, including any extended [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] content.
By design this WriteAsync method does not call the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WritingPrintTicketRequired> event.
The path of the source document.

Writes asynchronously paginated content from a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator"></xref> to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.
An object that contains a pointer to unpaginated source material and also contains methods for paginating the material.

Writes asynchronously a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument"></xref> to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.

Although the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> class has a singular name, an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> can be one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of multiple documents.
This method adds a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> to the set.
The document that is written.

Writes asynchronously a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocumentSequence"></xref> to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.

Although the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> class has a singular name, an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> can be one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of multiple documents.
This method adds a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> elements to the existing set.
The set of documents that is written.

Writes asynchronously a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.
The page that is written.

Writes asynchronously a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.
To batch write a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Visual>, use <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> that is written.

Writes asynchronously a specified [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] document with notification option to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.

When `notificationLevel` is disabled, the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter> copies the serialized [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] document to the target <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> or <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> that created the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter>.

When `notificationLevel` is enabled, the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter> first deserializes the document, next reserializes it, and then writes it to the target with progress notifications as each page is output.

Although the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> class has a singular name, an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> can be one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of multiple documents.

This method adds the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> elements in the source to the sequence of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> elements in the target <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> or <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.
If `notificationLevel` is specified as <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentNotificationLevel>, notifications are produced only when the document is serialized, not printed.
To receive notifications the document must be reserialized.

When a document is reserialized all content from the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package> that is not required to be preserved by the [XML Paper Specification](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=65761) is removed.

The reserialization will also remove all extensions from the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> markup, including any extended [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] content.
If `notificationLevel` is specified as <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentNotificationLevel> the document will not be reserialized and any extended content will be preserved, even when printed.
By design this WriteAsync method does not call the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WritingPrintTicketRequired> event.
The path of the source document.
An indication of whether notification is enabled.

Writes asynchronously paginated content from a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator"></xref> to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.
An object that contains a pointer to unpaginated source material; also contains methods for paginating the material.
A user-specified object to identify and associate with the asynchronous operation.

Writes asynchronously paginated content from a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator"></xref> together with a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.
This method does not validate or modify the specified `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.

If necessary, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is specific to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> and is valid for a specified printer.
An object that contains a pointer to unpaginated source material and also contains methods for paginating the material.
A <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> that represents the default printing preferences for the material.

Writes asynchronously a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument"></xref> to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.

Although the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> class has a singular name, an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> can be one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of multiple documents.
This method adds a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> to the set.
The document that is written.
A user-specified object to identify and associate with the asynchronous operation.

Writes asynchronously a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument"></xref> together with a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.

Although the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> class has a singular name, an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> can be one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of multiple documents.
This method adds a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> to the set.
This method does not validate or modify the specified `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.

If necessary, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is specific to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> and is valid for a specified printer.
The document that is written.
A <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> that represents the default printing preferences for the document.

Writes asynchronously a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocumentSequence"></xref> to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.

Although the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> class has a singular name, an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> can be one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of multiple documents.
This method adds a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> elements to the existing set.
The set of documents that are written.
A user-specified object to identify and associate with the asynchronous operation.

Writes asynchronously a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocumentSequence"></xref> together with a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.

Although the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> class has a singular name, an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> can be one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of multiple documents.
This method adds a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> elements to the existing set.
This method does not validate or modify the specified `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.

If necessary, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is specific to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> and is valid for a specified printer.
The set of documents that are written.
A <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> that represents the default printing preferences for the set of documents.

Writes asynchronously a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.
The page that is written.
A user-specified object to identify and associate with the asynchronous operation.

Writes asynchronously a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> together with a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.
This method does not validate or modify the specified `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.

If necessary, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is specific to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> and is valid for a specified printer.
The page that is written.
A <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> that represents the default printing preferences for the page.

Writes asynchronously a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.
To batch write a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Visual>, use <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> that is written.
A user-specified object to identify and associate with the asynchronous operation.

Writes asynchronously a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> together with a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.
To batch write a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Visual>, use <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument>.
This method does not validate or modify the specified `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.

If necessary, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is specific to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> and is valid for a specified printer.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> that is written.
A <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> that represents the default printing preferences for the document.

Writes asynchronously paginated content from a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator"></xref> together with a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.
This method does not validate or modify the specified `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.

If necessary, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is specific to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> and is valid for a specified printer.
An object that contains a pointer to unpaginated source material; also contains methods for paginating the material.
A <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> that represents the default printing preferences for the material.
A user-specified object to identify and associate with the asynchronous operation.

Writes asynchronously a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument"></xref> together with a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.

Although the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> class has a singular name, an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> can be one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of multiple documents.
This method adds a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> to the set.
This method does not validate or modify the specified `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.

If necessary, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is specific to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> and is valid for a specified printer.
The document that is written.
A <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> that represents the default printing preferences for the document.
A user-specified object to identify and associate with the asynchronous operation.

Writes asynchronously a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocumentSequence"></xref> together with a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.

WriteAsync writes a set of documents asynchronously to the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> or <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> that created the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter>.
The data that is written includes a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> and additional information that the caller wants to pass to an event handler.

Although the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> class has a singular name, an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> can be one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of multiple documents.
This method adds a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> elements to the existing sequence.
This method does not validate or modify the specified `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.

If necessary, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is specific to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> and is valid for a specified printer.
The set of documents to be written.
A <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> that represents the default printing preferences for the set of documents.
A user-specified object to identify and associate with the asynchronous operation.

Writes asynchronously a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> together with a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.
This method does not validate or modify the specified `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.

If necessary, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is specific to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> and is valid for a specified printer.
The page that is written.
A <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> that represents the default printing preferences for the page.
A user-specified object to identify and associate with the asynchronous operation.

Writes asynchronously a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> together with a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> to the target <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.
For writing multiple <xref:System.Windows.Media.Visual> elements, use <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument>.
This method does not validate or modify the specified `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.

If necessary, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is specific to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> and is valid for a specified printer.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> that is written.
A <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> that represents the default printing preferences for the document.
A user-specified object to identify and associate with the asynchronous operation.
Occurs when a <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.Write*> or <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WriteAsync*> operation is canceled.
To be added.
Occurs when a write operation finishes.
To be added.

Occurs just before a <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.Write*> or <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WriteAsync*> method adds a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> to a document or print queue.
WritingPrintTicketRequired enables an event handler to substitute a new <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> for the one that is passed to the write operation.

The following four <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.Write%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WriteAsync%2A> methods do not call the WritingPrintTicketRequired event: - <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.Write%2A>(~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) - <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.Write%2A>(~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md XpsDocumentNotificationLevel) - <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WriteAsync%2A>(String) - <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WriteAsync%2A>(String, XpsDocumentNotificationLevel)
To be added.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter"></xref> updates its progress.
To be added.
